articles.title: Repeated boosters of existing COVID-19 vaccines not a viable strategy against emerging variants: WHO advisers - channelnewsasia.com
articles.description:
GENEVA: WHO experts warned on Tuesday (Jan 11) that repeating booster doses of the original COVID-19 vaccines is not a viable strategy against emerging variants and called for new jabs that better protect against transmission.

articles.title: Genting's shipbuilding units in Germany file for bankruptcy - The Star Online
articles.description: Frankfurt: Asian tourism and casinos giant Genting’s shipbuilding subsidiaries in Germany filed for bankruptcy on Monday, which one union leader described as a “dark day” for the country’s dockyards.

articles.title: Over 50% of Europeans on track to contract Omicron: WHO - Moneycontrol
articles.description: The WHO's European region comprises 53 countries and territories including several in Central Asia, and regional director Hans Kluge noted that 50 of them had confirmed cases of the Omicron variant.
articles.content: More than half of people in Europe are on track to contract the Omicron coronavirus variant in the next two months if infections continue at current rates, the World Health Organization said Tuesday.… [+2475 chars]
